definitions: medical device or medication used to prevent disease or infection
any action or measure taken to prevent something harmful from occurring
examples: The doctor recommended using prophylactic antibiotics before the surgery
Many travelers take prophylactic malaria medication when visiting tropical regions
Regular hand washing is an effective prophylactic against spreading germs
The company implemented prophylactic measures to prevent data breaches

definitions: person who supports or advocates for a particular idea, proposal, or course of action
examples: She was a strong proponent of renewable energy policies
The senator became a vocal proponent of healthcare reform
Proponents of the new law argued it would reduce crime rates
Environmental proponents gathered signatures for the petition

definitions: mathematical term describing a constant ratio between two quantities or variables
electoral system where seats are allocated based on percentage of votes received
examples: The force is proportional to the mass of the object
Her salary increase was proportional to her years of experience
Many European countries use a proportional representation system
The proportional voting system ensures minority parties get representation

definitions: state or quality of being proportional where elements maintain appropriate relative sizes or amounts
examples: The architect emphasized proportionality in the building's design
Courts must consider proportionality when determining criminal sentences
The principle of proportionality guides military responses in conflicts
There was no proportionality between the offense and the punishment

definitions: person who formally puts forward a suggestion, plan, or nomination for consideration
examples: The proposer of the motion spoke first during the debate
Each candidate needs a proposer and seconder for nomination
The proposer outlined the benefits of the new policy
As the proposer of the toast, he raised his glass

definitions: product or technology that is owned exclusively by a particular company or individual
relating to ownership or the rights and behaviors of an owner
examples: The software uses a proprietary file format that only works with their program
Many pharmaceutical companies develop proprietary drugs protected by patents
He had a proprietary attitude toward the project he created
The restaurant's proprietary blend of spices remained a secret

definitions: person who owns and operates a business establishment or property
examples: The proprietor of the bookstore greeted customers personally
Local proprietors met to discuss improving the shopping district
The inn's proprietor had owned the building for thirty years
Small business proprietors often work long hours

definitions: form of business organization where one individual owns and operates the entire business
examples: She converted her business from a proprietorship to a corporation
Sole proprietorship is the simplest form of business ownership
The advantages of proprietorship include complete control and simple taxes
Many small businesses start as proprietorships before expanding

definitions: conformity to conventional standards of behavior or morals considered proper in social situations
examples: Victorian society placed great emphasis on propriety and decorum
She questioned the propriety of discussing such matters in public
The judge maintained strict propriety throughout the controversial trial
Social propriety dictated that they should not be alone together

definitions: action or process of driving or pushing something forward using force or energy
examples: The rocket's propulsion system uses liquid hydrogen as fuel
Marine biologists study the propulsion methods of different sea creatures
Jet propulsion revolutionized air travel in the twentieth century
The submarine uses nuclear propulsion for underwater navigation

definitions: official forbidding or banning of something by law or other authority
examples: The proscription of certain political parties led to underground movements
Religious proscriptions governed what foods could be eaten
The university's proscription against plagiarism is strictly enforced
Medieval proscriptions often targeted specific books or ideas

definitions: written or spoken language in its ordinary form without metrical structure of poetry
examples: She preferred writing prose to poetry for expressing complex ideas
The novel was written in clear, elegant prose
His prose style was direct and easy to understand
The teacher asked students to convert the poem into prose

definitions: person who searches for mineral deposits, especially precious metals, in the earth
examples: Gold prospectors rushed to California during the 1849 gold rush
The old prospector spent years searching the mountains for silver
Modern prospectors use advanced technology to locate mineral deposits
The prospector's equipment included picks, pans, and shovels

definitions: formal written document that provides details about an investment offering or educational institution
examples: Investors should carefully read the prospectus before buying shares
The university prospectus outlined all available degree programs
The company's prospectus revealed its financial history and future plans
She collected prospectuses from several colleges before applying

definitions: state of being successful, thriving, or flourishing, especially in financial terms
examples: The nation enjoyed unprecedented prosperity during the economic boom
Their hard work eventually led to prosperity and financial security
The town's prosperity depended on the success of local industries
Economic prosperity often leads to improved quality of life

definitions: walnut-sized gland in males that produces fluid that nourishes and transports sperm
examples: Regular prostate exams are recommended for men over fifty
The doctor explained that the prostate surrounds the urethra
Prostate cancer is one of the most common cancers in men
An enlarged prostate can cause difficulty with urination

definitions: person who engages in sexual activity in exchange for payment or other benefits
examples: Social workers provide support services for prostitutes seeking help
The documentary explored the lives of prostitutes in different countries
Laws regarding prostitutes vary significantly between jurisdictions
Many prostitutes face dangerous working conditions and exploitation

definitions: practice or business of engaging in sexual relations for payment or material benefit
examples: Debates about legalizing prostitution continue in many countries
The organization works to help women escape from prostitution
Street prostitution has declined in areas with increased policing
Online platforms have changed how prostitution operates globally

definitions: state of extreme physical weakness or exhaustion causing inability to move
act of lying stretched out on the ground as gesture of submission or worship
examples: Heat prostration affected several marathon runners during the race
The patient's prostration worried the medical team
Religious prostration is practiced during certain prayer rituals
The monks performed prostration before the altar

definitions: main character in a story, novel, play, or movie around whom the plot revolves
leading supporter or champion of a particular cause or idea
examples: The protagonist of the novel faces many challenges throughout the story
Audiences often identify with the protagonist's struggles and triumphs
She became a protagonist in the fight for women's rights
The senator was a key protagonist in healthcare reform

definitions: economic policy of restricting imports through tariffs and other measures to protect domestic industries
examples: Rising protectionism threatens international trade agreements
The country's protectionism helped develop local manufacturing
Critics argue protectionism ultimately harms consumer choice and prices
Economic protectionism increased during the global recession

definitions: person who advocates for or implements policies that protect domestic industries from foreign competition
examples: Protectionists argue that tariffs save domestic jobs
The senator was known as a strong protectionist
Free trade advocates often clash with protectionists
Protectionist policies can lead to trade wars

definitions: person who protects someone or something from danger or harm
device or equipment designed to prevent damage or injury
examples: The bodyguard served as her protector during public appearances
Parents are natural protectors of their children
Always wear a chest protector when playing baseball
The surge protector prevented damage to the computer

definitions: state or territory controlled and protected by another more powerful country
examples: The island nation was a British protectorate until independence
Colonial powers established protectorates throughout Africa
The protectorate maintained local rulers under foreign supervision
Protectorates often had limited sovereignty over internal affairs

definitions: person who receives support, protection, or training from someone more experienced or influential
examples: The famous artist took on several proteges each year
Her protege went on to become a successful entrepreneur
The professor's protege continued his research after graduation
Being someone's protege opens doors but requires hard work

definitions: positively charged particle found in the nucleus of every atom
examples: The number of protons determines an element's atomic number
Hydrogen atoms contain just one proton in their nucleus
Scientists accelerate protons in particle physics experiments
Protons and neutrons make up most of an atom's mass

definitions: first or preliminary version of a device or product from which others are developed
examples: Engineers tested the prototype before mass production began
The prototype car showcased innovative design features
Software developers created a prototype to demonstrate functionality
Several prototype versions were built before the final design

definitions: something that sticks out or projects from a surface or body
examples: The rock protrusion made climbing difficult at that point
A small protrusion on the wall marked where the nail had been
The doctor examined the unusual protrusion on the patient's neck
Tree root protrusions created an uneven walking surface

definitions: place of origin or earliest known history of something, especially artwork or artifacts
examples: The painting's provenance could be traced back three centuries
Collectors value items with clear provenance documentation
The provenance of the ancient manuscript remained mysterious
Wine experts consider provenance when evaluating rare bottles

definitions: short traditional saying that expresses a general truth or piece of advice
examples: The proverb 'actions speak louder than words' guided her decisions
Many proverbs contain wisdom passed down through generations
Different cultures have proverbs expressing similar ideas
His grandmother often quoted proverbs to make her point

definitions: protective care or guidance believed to come from God or divine power
capital and largest city of the state of Rhode Island
examples: They trusted in providence to guide them through difficult times
Many religious people believe providence shapes their lives
Providence is known for its historic architecture and universities
The conference will be held in downtown Providence

definitions: person from or relating to a province rather than the capital
person considered unsophisticated or having limited perspectives
examples: The provincial governor implemented new regional policies
Provincial officials met to discuss local infrastructure needs
His provincial attitudes showed he had never traveled abroad
Don't be so provincial; try to see other perspectives

definitions: condition or qualification attached to an agreement, statement, or decision
examples: The contract included a proviso about delivery dates
She accepted the offer with one important proviso
The law passed with a proviso protecting existing businesses
Several provisos were added during the final negotiations

definitions: person who deliberately provokes trouble, controversy, or violent action
examples: The agent provocateur infiltrated the peaceful protest group
Fashion provocateurs challenge conventional style boundaries
Political provocateurs use social media to stir controversy
The artist was known as a provocateur who challenged norms

definitions: action or speech that deliberately makes someone angry or causes them to react
examples: He remained calm despite repeated provocations from opponents
The border incident was seen as a military provocation
Her provocations were designed to expose their true beliefs
Responding to provocation with violence is never justified

definitions: senior administrative officer in certain universities or colleges
military police officer or head of military police
examples: The provost announced new academic policies for the semester
Faculty concerns were addressed directly to the provost
The provost marshal investigated allegations of misconduct
Military provosts maintain discipline within armed forces

definitions: front part or bow of a ship or boat that cuts through water
examples: The ship's prow sliced through the heavy waves
Vikings decorated their prows with carved dragon heads
Standing at the prow, she watched dolphins swimming alongside
Ice had formed on the prow during the arctic voyage

definitions: act of moving stealthily or restlessly, especially in search of prey or opportunity
examples: The tiger's prowl through the jungle was completely silent
Security guards patrol to prevent prowl burglaries
He went on a midnight prowl looking for a late-night snack
The prowl car moved slowly through the neighborhood

definitions: person who moves stealthily around, especially at night with criminal intent
examples: Neighbors reported seeing a prowler near the garage
Motion sensor lights help deter prowlers from properties
The prowler was caught on security camera footage
Police increased patrols after reports of prowlers

definitions: state of being near in space, time, or relationship to something
examples: The house's proximity to good schools increased its value
Living in close proximity to family has many benefits
The proximity sensor activated when someone approached the door
Their proximity to the border influenced their cultural practices

definitions: person authorized to act on behalf of another, especially in voting
figure or measurement that represents or stands in for something else
examples: Shareholders can vote by proxy if they cannot attend meetings
She appointed her lawyer as proxy for the negotiations
Temperature records serve as a proxy for climate data
Test scores are often used as a proxy for student achievement

definitions: quality of being careful and sensible in making judgments and decisions to avoid risks
examples: Financial prudence helped them weather the economic downturn
The judge showed prudence in considering all evidence
Prudence dictates that we should save for emergencies
Her natural prudence prevented her from making hasty decisions

definitions: plum that has been dried for preservation and has a dark wrinkled appearance
examples: Prunes are known for their digestive health benefits
She added chopped prunes to the morning oatmeal
The recipe called for prunes soaked in brandy
Many people eat prunes to increase their fiber intake

definitions: act of cutting away dead or overgrown branches to encourage healthy growth
examples: Spring pruning helps roses bloom more abundantly
The gardener's careful pruning shaped the hedge perfectly
Pruning fruit trees requires knowledge of proper techniques
Regular pruning keeps the garden looking neat and healthy

definitions: act of inquiring nosily into someone's private affairs or forcing something open
examples: Her constant pry into their business annoyed the neighbors
It took considerable pry to open the stuck window
Despite his pry, she refused to reveal her secrets
The pry bar helped them remove the old floorboards
